intro: Caulinia ovalis, commonly known as the oval leaf caulinia, is a herbaceous plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes cotton and hibiscus. The plant is characterized by its oval-shaped leaves and small, clustered flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sunlight. Caulinia ovalis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive foliage and delicate blooms.
